info.title: Product Inventory Management
info.description: This is Swagger UI environment generated for the TMF Product Inventory Management specification

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma separated properties to display in response

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: For filtering: Name of the product. It could be the same as the name of the product offering

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: For filtering: Is the lifecycle status of the product.

parameters.name: isCustomerVisible
parameters.description: For filtering: If true, the product is visible by the customer.

parameters.name: isBundle
parameters.description: For filtering: If true, the product is a ProductBundle which is an instantiation of a BundledProductOffering. If false, the product is a ProductComponent which is an instantiation of a SimpleProductOffering.

parameters.name: productSerialNumber
parameters.description: For filtering: Is the serial number for the product. This is typically applicable to tangible products e.g. Broadband Router.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: For filtering: Is the date from which the product starts

parameters.name: orderDate
parameters.description: For filtering: Is the date when the product was ordered

parameters.name: terminationDate
parameters.description: For filtering: Is the date when the product was terminated

parameters.name: place
parameters.description: For filtering: is a link to the place where the product is provided

parameters.name: productOffering.name
parameters.description: For filtering: Name of the product offering

parameters.name: billingAccount.name
parameters.description: For filtering: Name of the billing account

parameters.name: productCharacteristic.name
parameters.description: For filtering: Name of the characteristic

parameters.name: productCharacteristic.value
parameters.description: For filtering: Value of the characteristic

parameters.name: productRelationship.type
parameters.description:
For filtering: Type of the product relationship. It can be :
  • "bundled" if the product is a bundle and you want to describe the "bundled" products inside this bundle
  • "reliesOn" if the product needs another already owned product to rely on (e.g. an option on an already owned mobile access product)
"targets" or "isTargeted" (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

parameters.name: relatedParty.role
parameters.description: For filtering: Role of the related party.

parameters.name: relatedParty.name
parameters.description: For filtering: Name of the related party

parameters.name: productPrice.name
parameters.description: For filtering: A short descriptive name such as "Subscription price".

parameters.name: productPrice.priceType
parameters.description: For filtering: A category that describes the price, such as recurring, discount, allowance, penalty, and so forth.

parameters.name: productPrice.recurringChargePeriod
parameters.description: For filtering: Could be month, week...

parameters.name: productPrice.unitOfMeasure
parameters.description: For filtering: Could be minutes, GB...

parameters.name: productSpecification.version
parameters.description: For filtering: Version of the product specification

parameters.name: productSpecification.name
parameters.description: For filtering: Name of the product specification

post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

Product.description: A product offering procured by a customer or other interested party playing a party role. A product is realized as one or more service(s) and / or resource(s).

name.description: Name of the product. It could be the same as the name of the product offering

description.description: Is the description of the product. It could be copied from the description of the Product Offering.

status.description: Is the lifecycle status of the product.

isCustomerVisible.description: If true, the product is visible by the customer.

isBundle.description: If true, the product is a ProductBundle which is an instantiation of a BundledProductOffering. If false, the product is a ProductComponent which is an instantiation of a SimpleProductOffering.

productSerialNumber.description: Is the serial number for the product. This is typically applicable to tangible products e.g. Broadband Router.

startDate.description: Is the date from which the product starts

orderDate.description: Is the date when the product was ordered

terminationDate.description: Is the date when the product was terminated

place.description: is a link to the place where the product is provided

Product_Create.description:
A product offering procured by a customer or other interested party playing a party role. A product is realized as one or more service(s) and / or resource(s).
Skipped properties: id,href

name.description: Name of the product. It could be the same as the name of the product offering

description.description: Is the description of the product. It could be copied from the description of the Product Offering.

status.description: Is the lifecycle status of the product.

isCustomerVisible.description: If true, the product is visible by the customer.

isBundle.description: If true, the product is a ProductBundle which is an instantiation of a BundledProductOffering. If false, the product is a ProductComponent which is an instantiation of a SimpleProductOffering.

productSerialNumber.description: Is the serial number for the product. This is typically applicable to tangible products e.g. Broadband Router.

startDate.description: Is the date from which the product starts

orderDate.description: Is the date when the product was ordered

terminationDate.description: Is the date when the product was terminated

place.description: is a link to the place where the product is provided

Product_Update.description:
A product offering procured by a customer or other interested party playing a party role. A product is realized as one or more service(s) and / or resource(s).
Skipped properties: id,href

name.description: Name of the product. It could be the same as the name of the product offering

description.description: Is the description of the product. It could be copied from the description of the Product Offering.

status.description: Is the lifecycle status of the product.

isCustomerVisible.description: If true, the product is visible by the customer.

isBundle.description: If true, the product is a ProductBundle which is an instantiation of a BundledProductOffering. If false, the product is a ProductComponent which is an instantiation of a SimpleProductOffering.

productSerialNumber.description: Is the serial number for the product. This is typically applicable to tangible products e.g. Broadband Router.

startDate.description: Is the date from which the product starts

orderDate.description: Is the date when the product was ordered

terminationDate.description: Is the date when the product was terminated

place.description: is a link to the place where the product is provided

RealizingServiceRef.description: RealizingService reference. RealizingService is a link to the service that realizes the product.

ProductOfferingRef.description: ProductOffering reference. A product offering represents entities that are orderable from the provider of the catalog, this resource includes pricing information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product offering

BillingAccountRef.description: BillingAccount reference. A BillingAccount is a detailed description of a customer's bill structure.

id.description: Unique identifier of the billing account

ProductCharacteristic.description: Characteristics of the product to instantiate or to modify

ProductRelationship.description:
Linked products to the one instantiate, it can be :
  • "bundled" if the product is a bundle and you want to describe the "bundled" products inside this bundle
  • "reliesOn" if the product needs another already owned product to rely on (e.g. an option on an already owned mobile access product)
"targets" or "isTargeted" (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

type.description:
Type of the product relationship. It can be :
  • "bundled" if the product is a bundle and you want to describe the "bundled" products inside this bundle
  • "reliesOn" if the product needs another already owned product to rely on (e.g. an option on an already owned mobile access product)
"targets" or "isTargeted" (depending on the way of expressing the link) for any other kind of links that may be useful

RealizingResourceRef.description: RealizingResource reference. RealizingResource is a link to the resource that realizes the product.

RelatedPartyRef.description: RelatedParty reference. RelatedParty defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related party

href.description: Reference of the related party, could be a party reference or a partyRole reference

validFor.description: Validity period of the related party

ProductPrice.description: An amount, usually of money, that represents the actual price paid by a Customer for a purchase, a rent or a lease of a Product. The price is valid for a defined period of time.

name.description: A short descriptive name such as "Subscription price".

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail the semantics of this product price.

validFor.description: The period for which the price is valid.

priceType.description: A category that describes the price, such as recurring, discount, allowance, penalty, and so forth.

ProductSpecificationRef.description: Product specification reference: A ProductSpecification is a detailed description of a tangible or intangible object made available externally in the form of a ProductOffering to customers or other parties playing a party role.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product specification

BundledProductOfferingRef.description: BundledProductOffering Reference. A type of ProductOffering that belongs to a grouping of ProductOfferings made available to the market. It inherits of all attributes of ProductOffering.

id.description: Unique identifier of the product offering

ProductRef.description:
Product reference. Configure the product characteristics (only configurable characteristics and necessary only if a non default value is selected) and/or identify the product that needs to be modified/deleted
May be a bundle product instantiation, in this case, it will contain the list of bundled product to instantiate
<u>Nota</u> : Each product to instantiate corresponds to a purchased productOffering. In case of bundles, the order of the list in the productOffering bundle must match the order of the list in the product instance bundle to deliver.

Place.description: Used to defined a place useful for the product (for example a delivery geographical place)

href.description: Reference of a place (for instance in google map)

role.description: Role of the place (for instance delivery geographical place)

TimePeriod.description: A base / value business entity used to represent a period of time between two timepoints.

startDateTime.description: An instant of time, starting at the TimePeriod

endDateTime.description: An instant of time, ending at the TimePeriod.

ProdPriceAlteration.description: Is an amount, usually of money, that modifies the price charged for a Product.

name.description: A short descriptive name such as "Monthly discount"

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail the semantics of this ProdPriceAlteration

validFor.description: The period for which the ProdPriceAlteration is valid

priceType.description: A category that describes the price such as recurring, one shot and so forth.

applicationDuration.description: Duration during which the ProdPriceAlteration applies on the ProductPrice (for instance 2 months free of charge for the recurring charge)

priceCondition.description: Condition that triggers the price application

Price.description: Provides all amounts (tax included, duty free, tax rate), used currency and percentage to apply for ProdOfferPriceAlteration.

taxIncludedAmount.description: All taxes included amount (expressed in the given currency)

dutyFreeAmount.description: All taxes excluded amount (expressed in the given currency)

currencyCode.description: A string used as a code for specifying the currency associated to the given amounts. The ISO4217 norm uses 3 letters to define the currency (for example USD for US dollar or EUR for Euro)

priceType.description: Indicates the price type: recurring, one time, usage

ProductCreationNotification.description: The ProductCreation notification is sent to each listener who has subscribed to receive it.

resourcePath.description: To indicate which entity is concerned

fieldPath.description: details which field is missing, its structure is quite similar to GET filter criteria

ProductStatusChangeNotification.description: The ProductStatusChange notification is sent to each listener who has subscribed to receive it.

resourcePath.description: To indicate which entity is concerned

fieldPath.description: details which field is missing, its structure is quite similar to GET filter criteria

ProductEvent.description: The Product event is generated each time a product has been created, updated or deleted.

ProductOrderEvent.description: The ProductOrder event is generated each time a product order is created, updated or an information is required.

ProductOrder.description: A Product Order is a type of order which  can  be used to place an order  between a customer and a service provider or between a service provider and a partner and vice versa,

id.description: ID created on repository side (OM system)

externalId.description: ID given by the consumer and only understandable by him (to facilitate his searches afterwards)

priority.description: A way that can be used by consumers to prioritize orders in OM system (from 0 to 4 : 0 is the highest priority, and 4 the lowest)

category.description: Used to categorize the order from a business perspective that can be useful for the OM system (e.g. "enterprise", "residential", ...)

state.description: State of the order : described in the state-machine diagram

orderDate.description: Date when the order was created

completionDate.description: Date when the order was completed

requestedStartDate.description: Order start date wished by the requestor

requestedCompletionDate.description: Requested delivery date from the requestor perspective

expectedCompletionDate.description: Expected delivery date amended by the provider

notificationContact.description: Contact attached to the order to send back information regarding this order

Note.description: Extra information about the ticket or a product order

id.description: Identifier of the line item (generally it is a sequence number 01, 02, 03, ...)

state.description: State of the order item : described in the state machine diagram

appointment.description: Used to precise that an appointment was set up with a related party for this order item

code.description: An integer coding the error type. This is given to caller so he can translate them if required.

message.description: A short localized string that describes the error.

description.description: (optional) A long localized error description if needed. It can contain precise information about which parameter is missing, or what are the identifier acceptable values.

infoURL.description: (optional) A URL to online documentation that provides more information about the error.
